page.title: 16MEDIA.
page.content: {NEWS COVERAGE IN OWSTON AREA Every house in Owston has at least one television and radio. Some also have video equipment and Cee_Fax reception. Newspapers are delivered from Somerby daily and left at the village hall for collection, and on Sundays someone from the village, working on a rota system, collects the papers from Somerby and delivers them. The Leicester Mercury is delivered round the village every afternoon by one of the residents who also disseminates local news as he goes. Local events are reported to the press by a village correspondent living in Owston. A news sheet is produced in Knossington with details of local events and items of village news and this is distributed to every house. The county mobile library calls once a fortnight from Melton Mowbray.
